author: Lesley Waters
method: Place the steak, garlic, chilli, sesame oil, coriander and egg into a food processor. Blend to combine the ingredients.Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Transfer into a bowl and stir through the green beans. Lightly flour your hands and form the meat mixture into four patties. Heat the oil in a deep frying pan over a medium-high heat. Place the beef patties into the frying pan and fry for about three minutes on each side, until golden and cooked through. To serve, place the patties on a bed of fresh coriander leaves and sprinkle over the toasted sesame seeds.
ingredients: 175g/6oz rump steak, finely chopped,  1 garlic clove,  ¼ tsp dried chilli flakes,  ½ tsp sesame oil,  2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander,  ½ free-range egg, lightly beaten,  sea salt and freshly ground black pepper,  100g/3½ oz green beans, trimmed and thinly sliced,  1 tsp plain flour,  2 tbsp olive oil,  fresh coriander to garnish,  1 tsp toasted sesame seeds, to garnish
